Pardon me Anon. . 2nd attempt, since the first one failed (missing endpart). . If it is still not doable, i'll remove the sound. . 2 parts divided by 1 second break.. . . . . . If it's still not doable, i'll remove the sound. . . . thanks, Gerben. . . . reaction to 1st version:. . On the first version Anon's reply was:  could well be Blue-white flycatcher but can't be sure with this short sequence.

I'm not sure if this is a call or song!. . . . Early morning and I'm on my way to the beach to see if I can find any waders.  I pass the female Whinchat sitting on the flower. I have my camera in my lap and I'm lucky to get a few pictures.. . . . When I'm ready I take my ZOOM H5 Handy recorder and aim it out the window to get the recording. . . . [Picture 1](http://www.aladdin.st/bird-watching/sweden/86.jpg). . bird-seen:yes. . playback-used:no

Bird not seen, ID by Marc Anderson.

I don't know if it is a song or call, or an alarm call.. . . . Early morning on the beach. I hear the bird and I go to try to get a picture. But the bird take of hiding in the forest.. . . . I could hear the bird very close to me, but I could not see it. I sat down trying to play my recording to get the bird to come out so I could get  a picture.. . . . The bird never came out so I went to have another look and the bird was sitting on a branch calling or singing and I could take a picture. . . . I got help from BirdForum to identify the bird. . . . [Picture 1](http://www.aladdin.st/bird-watching/sweden/87.jpg). . bird-seen:yes. . playback-used:no

Early morning and I'm driving around looking for the cranes. I have got a few tip but nothing paid off. But suddenly they were in front of me on the road.. . . . No good pictures through the car window, but I was lucky and they flew off the the pasture next to the road so I could get  a picture.. . . . [Picture 1](http://www.aladdin.st/bird-watching/sweden/88.jpg). . bird-seen:yes. . playback-used:no

notes: Western Whistler was split from Golden Whistler by the IOC in 2014. The nearest subspecies of Golden Whistler "fuliginosa" does not occur in Western Australia and is seperated from Western Whistler in South Australia by 200km.  Rottnest Island lies to the west of Perth, and this bird was identifiable on location as much as anything else. It was in a bush on the edge of Garden Lake.. . bird-seen:yes. . playback-used:no

gatheringEvent.locality: Kissimmee Prairie State Preserve, Okeechobee County, Florida

associatedTaxa.name: Cardinalis cardinalis|Baeolophus bicolor|Sturnella magna|Strix varia|Geothlypis trichas|Corvus brachyrhynchos

notes: I think I'll eventually post this one up as a soundscape as it's a pretty nice morning chorus. I do have a few calls I'm interested in.  The first occurs at 0:55 and then again at 1:25 it's a short 3 and then2 note phrase,  probably a dove although  it sounds very clean and defined for most of the doves I hear. It has a wood thrush feel to it, but it's not the right habitat and I don't think they're common in this area. There's also a rattle at 2:09 I can't quite place. Thanks in advance for the help. The habitat is a grass/palmetto prairie that's dotted with wetlands and hardwood hammocks. . . bird-seen:no. . playback-used:no
. . bird-seen:yes. . playback-used:no
